required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Nalmefene in Patients With Alcohol Dependence
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-week, Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy Study of Nalmefene, as Needed Use, in Patients With Alcohol Dependence

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is long-term safety, tolerability and efficacy of nalmefene in patients with alcohol dependence.

detailed_description.textblock: Alcohol dependence is a maladaptive pattern of alcohol use, leading to clinically significant impairment or distress, as manifested by at least three of a number of criteria such as tolerance, withdrawal symptoms, frequent use of alcohol in larger amounts or over longer periods than was intended, and others. Excessive intake of alcohol reduces the life span by a decade, and alcohol drinking is strongly related to mortality from liver cirrhosis, chronic pancreatitis, certain cancers, hypertension, accidents and violence. This study is planned to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability as well as to evaluate the efficacy of as needed use of 18.06 mg nalmefene in patients with alcohol dependence.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events: 52 weeks and a safety follow-up (visit/telephone call) scheduled for 4 weeks after completion of the study or after withdrawal from the study. Other Adverse Events: 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Withdrew Due to Intolerance to Treatment
Change From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs)
primary_outcome.description: Number of HDDs over a month (28 days), where one HDD was defined as a day with alcohol consumption ≥60 grams (g) for men and ≥40 g for women.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC)
primary_outcome.description: TAC was defined as mean daily alcohol consumption in g/day over a month (28 days).

secondary_outcome.description: RSDRL response was defined as a downward shift from baseline in Drinking Risk Level (DRL); for patients at very high risk at Baseline: a shift to medium risk or below, and for patients at high or medium risk at Baseline: a shift to low risk or below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Status Using CGI-S
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's current state of mental illness. The clinician uses his or her clinical experience of this patient population to rate the severity of the patient's current mental illness on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal - not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Status Using the CGI-I
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Global Improvement (CGI-I) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's improvement (or worsening). The clinician assesses the patient's condition relative to a baseline on a 7- point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of HDDs over a month (28 days), where one HDD was defined as a day with alcohol consumption ≥60 g for men and ≥40 g for women.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC)
secondary_outcome.description: TAC was defined as mean daily alcohol consumption in g/day over a month (28 days).

RSDRL response was defined as a downward shift from baseline in Drinking Risk Level (DRL); for patients at very high risk at Baseline: a shift to medium risk or below, and for patients at high or medium risk at Baseline: a shift to low risk or below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Status Using CGI-S
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's current state of mental illness. The clinician uses his or her clinical experience of this patient population to rate the severity of the patient's current mental illness on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal - not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Clinical Status Using the CGI-I
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Global Improvement (CGI-I) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's improvement (or worsening). The clinician assesses the patient's condition relative to a baseline on a 7- point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

intervention.description: 18.06 mg as-needed use, tablets, orally, 52 weeks. 18.06 mg nalmefene equals 20 mg nalmefene hydrochloride.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
In- and outpatients who:
- had a primary diagnosis of alcohol dependence according to Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders - text revision (DSM-IV-TR) criteria
- had had ≥6 Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs) in the 4 weeks preceding the Screening Visit
Exclusion Criteria:
The patient:
- had a severe psychiatric disorder or an antisocial personality disorder
- had risk of suicide evaluated by the suicidality module of the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI)
- had a history of delirium tremens or alcohol withdrawal seizures
- reported current or recent (within 3 months preceding screening) treatment with disulfiram, acamprosate, topiramate, naltrexone or carbimide, or with any opioid antagonists
- was pregnant or breast-feeding
Other protocol-defined inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.

overall_official.last_name: Email contact via H. Lundbeck A/S

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events: 52 weeks and a safety follow-up (visit/telephone call) scheduled for 4 weeks after completion of the study or after withdrawal from the study. Other Adverse Events: 52 weeks.
outcome.population: All-patients-treated set (APTS) – all patients in the APRS excluding those with no recorded investigational medicinal product (IMP) intake and all IMP returned

measure.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Overview of AEs
measure.population: All-patients-treated set (APTS) – all patients in the APRS excluding those with no recorded investigational medicinal product (IMP) intake and all IMP returned

class.title: Patients with AEs Leading to Withdrawal

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Who Withdrew Due to Intolerance to Treatment

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Who Withdrew Due to Intolerance to Treatment

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs)
outcome.description: Number of HDDs over a month (28 days), where one HDD was defined as a day with alcohol consumption ≥60 grams (g) for men and ≥40 g for women.
outcome.population: Full-analysis set (FAS) - all patients in the APTS who had at least one valid post-baseline assessment in the main treatment period of both co-primary efficacy variables (HDD and TAC) and had an average alcohol consumption at medium Drinking Risk Level (DRL) or above according to WHO criteria at Baseline.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Heavy Drinking Days (HDDs)
measure.description: Number of HDDs over a month (28 days), where one HDD was defined as a day with alcohol consumption ≥60 grams (g) for men and ≥40 g for women.
measure.population: Full-analysis set (FAS) - all patients in the APTS who had at least one valid post-baseline assessment in the main treatment period of both co-primary efficacy variables (HDD and TAC) and had an average alcohol consumption at medium Drinking Risk Level (DRL) or above according to WHO criteria at Baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary hypothesis concerned the treatment effect at Month 6. Null hypothesis of no difference in treatment effect was tested against the alternative hypothesis that there was a difference in treatment effect. MMRM model with the Baseline score as a covariate; site, sex, time in months (Month 1-13); and treatment as fixed effects. The Baseline score-by-time and treatment-by-time interactions were also included in the model. An unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.method: Adjusted change from Baseline to Month 6
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 110 participants in the placebo group and 320 participants in the nalmefene group.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC)
outcome.description: TAC was defined as mean daily alcohol consumption in g/day over a month (28 days).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Monthly Total Alcohol Consumption (TAC)
measure.description: TAC was defined as mean daily alcohol consumption in g/day over a month (28 days).

analysis.groups_desc: The primary hypothesis concerned the treatment effect at Month 6. The null hypothesis of no difference in treatment effect was tested against the alternative hypothesis that there was a difference in treatment effect. MMRM model with the Baseline score as a covariate; site, sex, time in months (Month 1-13); and treatment as fixed effects. The Baseline score-by-time and treatment-by-time interactions were also included in the model. An unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.method: Adjusted change from Baseline to Month 6
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 110 participants in the placebo group and 320 participants in the nalmefene group.

outcome.title: Drinking Risk Level (RSDRL) Response
outcome.description: RSDRL response was defined as a downward shift from baseline in Drinking Risk Level (DRL); for patients at very high risk at Baseline: a shift to medium risk or below, and for patients at high or medium risk at Baseline: a shift to low risk or below.

measure.title: Drinking Risk Level (RSDRL) Response
measure.description: RSDRL response was defined as a downward shift from baseline in Drinking Risk Level (DRL); for patients at very high risk at Baseline: a shift to medium risk or below, and for patients at high or medium risk at Baseline: a shift to low risk or below.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis of RSDRL used a logistic regression (LREG) model, with country, sex, Baseline DRL, and treatment as fixed effects, and missing values were imputed using individual-patient predicted values of TAC derived from the MMRM model.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Status Using CGI-S
outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's current state of mental illness. The clinician uses his or her clinical experience of this patient population to rate the severity of the patient's current mental illness on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal - not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Status Using CGI-S
measure.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's current state of mental illness. The clinician uses his or her clinical experience of this patient population to rate the severity of the patient's current mental illness on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (Normal - not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

analysis.groups_desc: MMRM model with the Baseline score as a covariate, and site, sex, time in weeks, and treatment as fixed effects. The Baseline score-by-time and treatment-by-time interactions were also included in the model; an unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.method: Adjusted change from Baseline to Week 24
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 104 participants in the placebo group and 306 participants in the nalmefene group.

outcome.title: Change in Clinical Status Using the CGI-I
outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Global Improvement (CGI-I) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's improvement (or worsening). The clinician assesses the patient's condition relative to a baseline on a 7- point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

measure.title: Change in Clinical Status Using the CGI-I
measure.description: The Clinical Global Impression - Global Improvement (CGI-I) provides the clinician's impression of the patient's improvement (or worsening). The clinician assesses the patient's condition relative to a baseline on a 7- point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse).

analysis.groups_desc: MMRM model with the Baseline CGI-S score as a covariate, and site, sex, time in weeks, and treatment as fixed effects. The Baseline CGI-S score-by-time and treatment by- time interactions were also included in the model. An unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.method: Adjusted change from Baseline to Week 24
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 104 participants in the placebo group and 306 participants in the nalmefene group.

measure.title: Liver Function Test Gamma-glutamyl Transferase (GGT)
measure.description: GGT values

analysis.groups_desc: Log-transformed GGT values were analysed using an MMRM model with the logtransformed Baseline value as a covariate, and site, sex, time in weeks, and treatment as fixed effects. Log-transformed Baseline value-by-time interaction and treatment-by-time interaction were included in the model. An unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 108 participants in the placebo group and 319 participants in the nalmefene group.

measure.description: ALAT values

analysis.groups_desc: Log-transformed ALAT values were analysed using an MMRM model with the logtransformed Baseline value as a covariate, and site, sex, time in weeks, and treatment as fixed effects. Log-transformed Baseline value-by-time and treatment-by-time interactions were included in the model. An unstructured covariance matrix was used.
analysis.estimate_desc: The Number of Participants Analyzed is participants with efficacy measurement available at this endpoint, that is, 108 participants in the placebo group and 318 participants in the nalmefene group.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events: 52 weeks and a safety follow-up (visit/telephone call) scheduled for 4 weeks after completion of the study or after withdrawal from the study. Other Adverse Events: 52 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The main publication has to be published before any sub publication. The investigators shall obtain Lundbeck's written approval before publishing any publication relating to nalmefene, the Study, the Protocol and/or the results recorded during the Study.
